Description: Stone stela inscribed with four lines of Greek text coloured red.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie (1922, on behalf of BSAE)
Dimensions: Width: 96.70 centimetres (fixed stone base (object and base inclusive))
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1925b / Tombs of the courtiers and Oxyrhynkhos (p.18, pl.47.3.) (Attributed to reign of Justinian.)
Tudor 2011 / Christian Funerary Stelae of the Byzantine and Arab Periods from Egypt
Exhibition history: 2018 23 Feb – 22 Apr, Nashville, Frist Art Museum, 'Rome; City &Empire' 2018-2019 20 Sep-04 Feb, Canberra, National Museum of Australia, 'Rome; City &Empire' 2021-2022 25 Sep – 08 Oct, China, Suzhou Museum, 'Rome: City & Empire'
Acquisition name: Purchased from: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
